nodes.content: Learning silk embroidery from grandmother in the family workshop, watching five generations of tradition flow through careful, patient hands.
Starting Silk Heritage online boutique to bridge traditional Chinese craftsmanship with global markets and contemporary design.
Grandmother's teaching: 'Quality takes time, patience brings perfection' - the foundation of every piece I create.
Completing my MBA while secretly practicing traditional silk weaving techniques in the dormitory late at night.
The first international order - a wedding gown for a bride in New York who wanted to honor her Chinese heritage.
Morning tai chi in the courtyard, finding balance between ancient wisdom and modern business pressures.
Coordinating with family artisans via video calls, ensuring every piece meets our five-generation standard of excellence.
Supporting local silk artisan cooperatives to preserve traditional techniques while providing fair wages.
The weight of family expectations - carrying forward the legacy while forging my own international path.
Creating a wedding gown that perfectly balances Western silhouette with traditional Chinese embroidery techniques.
